As a general rule, you do not test setters and getters
if they are basic setters/getters.

as for the getMaterials method, get all the data and
populate it in the vector, then you can test the
values in the vector against hardcoded valuse that you
expect to be in the vector.

--- java faq <j2eefaq2003@...> wrote:
> 
> Hello Experts
> 
> I am quite new in Junit . I have written some small
> test cases .
> 
> I would like to know how to write test case for the
> following class.
> 
> 1.  This class has a couple of setter/getter methods
> .
> 
>      How do I write test cases for setter/getter
> methods ?
> 
> 2.  This class has a method 
> 
>      public vector getMaterials(int param).
> 
>      It connects to database and gets some records .
> This records are
> 
>      then inserted into a vector and returned .
> 
>      How do I test this case ? Please explain me in
> details 
> 
> ..
> 
> bye
> 
> 
>
